text: John Henry Derrick (8 December 1891 – April 1938) was an English professional footballer who made over 130 appearances as a forward in the Football League for Nottingham Forest. == Personal life == In June 1915, nine months after the outbreak of the First World War, Derrick enlisted as a private in the Leicestershire Regiment. He was wounded in Mesopotamia in April 1916. == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |FA Cup ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="7" |Nottingham Forest |1909–10 | rowspan="2" |First Division |5 |4 |0 |0 |5 |4 |- |1910–11 |19 |6 |1 |0 |20 |6 |- |1911–12 | rowspan="5" |Second Division |37 |6 |1 |0 |38 |6 |- |1912–13 |25 |10 |2 |1 |27 |11 |- |1913–14 |24 |8 |2 |0 |26 |8 |- |1914–15 |22 |2 |1 |0 |23 |2 |- |1919–20 |7 |0 |1 |0 |8 |0 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !139 !35 !8 !1 !147 !36 |} == References == Category:English footballers Category:English Football League players Category:Association football forwards Category:Nottingham Forest F.C. players Category:1891 births Category:1938 deaths Category:Association football outside forwards Category:Sportspeople from Nottingham Category:Aberaman Athletic F.C. players Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:Royal Leicestershire Regiment soldiers
title: John Derrick (footballer)
